tool.name: lines_scs
tool.summary: Loads points associated with Procedural Features along the hydrological network, traces upstream and downstream network segments using Network Analyst, and combines adjacent segments to create Stream Conservation Site lines.

param.name: in_Points
param.dialogReference: Input SCS points associated with Procedural Features along the hydrological network, output from the "1: Make Network Points from Procedural Features" tool.

param.name: in_downTrace
param.dialogReference: Network analyst service layer for downstream trace

param.name: in_upTrace
param.dialogReference: Network analyst service layer for upstream trace

param.name: in_tidalTrace
param.dialogReference: Network analyst service layer for tidal trace (all-directions)

param.name: fld_Tidal
param.dialogReference: Field in SCS points indicating if the tidal trace should be applied

param.name: out_Scratch
param.dialogReference:
Scratch geodatabase specified to store temporary/intermediate data.

If not specified, intermediate data will be stored in memory and will not persist; this is preferred for faster processing. It is recommended that you only specify a scratch geodatabase if you need to trouble-shoot poor automation results, or if your computer has insufficient memory for processing large datasets.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Loads points associated with Procedural Features along the hydrological network, gathers upstream and downstream network segments, and combines segments to create linear Stream Conservation Units (SCU).
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Virginia Natural Heritage Program (Kirsten Hazler, David Bucklin)
